segments.text: I can't believe what I'm seeing in this kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out of the sink, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the woman standing there, drying a plate like it's the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she's even aware of the mess she's making.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I'm watching a train wreck, and I can't look away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off that faucet before the whole kitchen is underwater.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like they're all in their own little worlds, completely oblivious to the chaos around them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe how calm they all are, given the situation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could just reach in and turn off that faucet myself.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think this is one of the most bizarre things I've ever seen.
segments.speaker: PAR
